lines.text: I've been waiting for something like this!
What do you mean?
I know you society swells wandering around the passages at night. Sneaking into strange bedrooms.
Don't be a fool. Julia's my wife.
She may be your wife, but she's my fiancée!
All I want is my 6950 francs.
6900 francs?
And 50. There's no reason now why I should pay for a nightgown.
6950 francs? What kind of a nightgown was this?
Very thin.
The organist always kisses the bride, its an old Welsh custom, you know, handed down from father to son. Excuse me.
Where's my mother?
She's in the bar drinking her breakfast!
those who admit they like women, and liars.

[Walking through the forest]
Look at that tree. How bent it is!
Oh, there is a reason for that.
Oh, really?

Oh, yes. You see, that's a boy tree and he's eyeing the girl tree. And he's saying, 'You're so beautiful with your lovely green hair and your nice brown bark skin.' You know what she is saying to him?

[Coyly laughs]
No, tell me, Ritchie.
She's saying, 'That won't do you any good at all. I have a heart of wood and, besides, I'm madly in love with the golden oak in the next forest.'

[Shyly]
Let's not pry into it deeper. How about that tree?
No, that's just a spruce. I can't understand a word he's saying.

[laughs]
Oh, Ritchie, you're such a fool. I'd almost forgotten how much fun you were.
Yes, I'm just like wool underwear.
Susan, I want to wish you every happiness. That's very important to me because you're the only girl I have ever loved. Oh, but I've got no right to tell you that. Forgive me.
There's nothing to forgive.
You're very kind. But as soon as the wedding is over, I'll pack up my traps and get out.
Where to?

[Feigning seriousness]
Oh, I don't know. Some of the wide open spaces beyond the behind. Probably the Congo. They call that "white man's grave."
They do? Why?
Oh, berry berry... black water fever... rinderpest.
Rinderpest? Why, I thought that was a cattle disease.
Yes. Men die like cattle.
Julia, let me have a look at the stuff.

[Behind a locked door]
Well you can't, I'm in the nude.
Well, get out of the nude.
Oh, for the love of Mike!
Look here, Ritchie, when I engaged you to paint these murals, you had definite instructions. You made some changes.
Agamemnon beating Psyche at table tennis?
William, don't be seen in public with her. You might meet some of our friends.
Mother, she's no longer a 17-year old chorus girl. She won't turn up in tights.
Oh, say, I bet if you took me in your arms you'd be just about crush me to death.
Well, you must be a riot with the women!
Oh, we always went pretty big with the men, too! It takes all sorts to make an audience, you know.
Happy hunting, Bunny!
And remember, William, you're a man and she's only a woman.
Oh, William, you've improved! Ohhh, yes, you've lost that gangly look.
Oh, well, I didn't know I ever had it.
Oh, not any more. Hmm, distinguished. Quite handsome. Very dangerous.
My, dear Julia, you're being most, eh...
Well, aren't you going to tell me how I look?
Don't you love Christmas! Even if you have to celebrate it in the middle of August?
Panties! Black panties. Every young girl feels so grown up and sophisticated wearing black panties.
Oh, William, don't be subtle. Tell Julia...
You're certainly in a gay mood!
Worry never solved a problem yet! Never trouble trouble, 'til trouble troubles you.
What were you doin' in a lingerie shop?
I was buying a negligee.
And a nightgown.
What did you need a nightgown for?
I didn't need a nightgown! I never wear nightgowns!
[pause]
I wear pajamas.
You'll never see me again! And I was going to make a Ghenoccio out of you! Hmm!
